column4: GRRR, I'm getting pissed off with dist-upgrading. I never get it working right :(
gksu "update-manager -c" asks password for ROOT, apt-get dist-upgrade x2 won't start upgrade (http://www.ubuntu.com/download/releasenotes/610)
gksudo, not gksu
docs says so... look at url
try it with gksudo.

gksu asks for the root password, while gksudo asks you for your own password. unless you want to actually set a root password and activate the root account, gksu will never work. i really don't know why they put gksu there instead of gksudo
gksudo won't start update-manager :(
that's really strange...
okay, well the reason apt-get isn't doing it is because you're probably still set on the dapper repos
sudo vi /etc/apt/sources.list
s/dapper/edgy/g
:wq
sudo apt-get update
*sigh* there is breezy on repos... Maybe I should upgrade it first :P
oh. yeah, you can't go from breezy to dapper
ty, sorry for troubles... I must then read how to upgrade breezy :/
same thing, only in the sources.list, do s/breezy/dapper/g
honestly though your system will probably be more stable if you just install edgy from scratch
I think that too, I haven't use this comps Ubuntu much, because USB kbd and mouse won't work an breezy
I have not testet, I'll burn install CD and install and try
they will probably work in edgy. download the edgy cd, burn it and boot from it to see if your keyboard and mouse work
usb kbd and mouse works, if I plug in ps/2 mouse and kbd before boot
i have a usb mouse and no ps/2 mouse, and it works fine in dapper and edgy. i'm using it right now.
This is HP computer :P
